channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why Putin's nuclear promise on Kudankulam matters
Why Putin’s visit brings good news for Indians eyeing jobs in Russia
IndiGo crisis: Why flyers don’t always get full refunds for cancelled flights
A flight to Dubai cheaper than Delhi-Mumbai? How domestic flight fares are soaring amid IndiGo meltdown
Russian oil, e-tourist visas and 2030 economic plan… The takeaways from Modi-Putin talks in Delhi
'India is not neutral...': How Modi's diplomacy has triumphed amid the Russia-Ukraine war
Ramification | Putin in New Delhi: How India balances Russia, America, and its own interests
item.description: As Putin walks the corridors of Hyderabad House and Washington analyses the optics from afar, one reality becomes unmistakable: India is now an active shaper of the emerging global order, on its own terms and at its own pace

item.title: The debt trap: Why Pakistan can’t escape its economic collapse
item.description: Pakistan currently faces $130 billion in external debt—that’s 352 per cent of its total exports and 39 per cent of gross national income

item.title: Putin in Delhi: India’s moment in a fragmenting world order
item.description: Vladimir Putin’s arrival in New Delhi, in the shadow of tariffs, war and an evolving peace plan, is one of the most consequential international events of the year

item.title: Putin’s Delhi visit poised to propel military aviation ties to new heights
item.description: Military aviation remains the biggest India-Russia ‘bear hug’ with the most significant hardware transfers

item.title: The death sentence that shames Bangladesh: Why Sheikh Hasina’s trial was a constitutional farce
item.description: Sheikh Hasina’s death sentence isn’t just an attack on one person; it’s an assault on the Constitution of Bangladesh itself

item.title: How India’s BrahMos missile deal with Indonesia signals a new strategic era
item.description: As Jakarta moves closer to a $450 million BrahMos purchase, India emerges as Southeast Asia’s long-awaited alternative amid the US-China rivalry
